definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Many of the remains were young or had deformities, such as dwarfism.
sentences.chinese: 許多遺體還很年輕或是有點殘疾，例如矮化。

sentences.english: The bacteria may gain entry and develop internally as in wilts and stunts .
sentences.chinese: 當植株產生萎蔫或矮化症時細菌可進入體內繁殖。

sentences.english: The control pollination and dwarfism of parent trees were also described in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 人工授粉和雜交親本樹矮化等實用技術。

sentences.english: Dwarf culture is tendency for fruit growing.
sentences.chinese: 矮化是果樹栽培發展的趨勢。

definition: rootstock (stem onto which a branch is grafted)
to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
tiller (stem at the base of grass plants)
ear (of corn or sorghum etc)/bunch (of grapes)/infructescence
to graft (a branch to a rootstock)
to grow/to cultivate/to train/to educate/to patronize
